{include "default_salutation"} –

I hope you will join me and many supporters of the ACLU on Tuesday, September 14, for back-to-back Emergency Town Halls. First, join us at 5 p.m. for an emergency Town Hall on Fighting Texas' Radical Abortion Ban, hosted by the national ACLU. This 30-45 minute event will premiere on YouTube. The second – the ACLU of Georgia Town Hall will follow immediately from 5:45 until 6:15 p.m.

You may have received an invitation to the national Town Hall with a link to the YouTube page, which we include here as well. Simply visit the ACLU's YouTube page at 5 p.m. Tuesday, September 14. No RSVP is required.

To join the ACLU of Georgia's event immediately following, RSVP on Zoom today, and we will send you the Zoom link.

Program and Speakers

The national ACLU Town Hall will cover the current crisis around Texas bill SB8 and reproductive rights, the ACLU's response, and what supporters can do to help. We will hear from our expert panel of lawyers and advocates about the impacts of SB8 and the ACLU's strategy to fight the Texas law and copycat bills across the country.

The speakers for the national YouTube event will be:

  • Brigitte Amiri, ACLU Reproductive Freedom Project deputy director
  • Drucilla Tigner, ACLU of Texas Policy & advocacy strategist
  • Jen Dalven, ACLU Reproductive Freedom Project director
  • Oni Blair, ACLU of Texas executive director

At the Georgia Zoom event, we will discuss our lawsuit to overturn the 2019 abortion ban in Georgia and this month's hearing on the state's appeal, as well as the implications of the Texas bill for Georgia and other Southern states fighting the new wave of repressive abortion bills. We will answer as many of your questions as we can in our half-hour together.

The speakers for the ACLU of Georgia event will be:

  • Andrea Young, ACLU of Georgia executive director
  • Sean Young, ACLU of Georgia legal director
  • Christopher Bruce, ACLU of Georgia political director

I hope to see you at both events. Please contact philanthropy@acluga.org with questions.

For Justice,
